meta.title: Police Jobs MCQs
meta.description: MCQs from the Punjab Highway Patrolling Police Paper held on 23-06-2024.
meta.keywords: punjab highway patrolling police, past paper, mcqs, quiz

subcategories.title: Punjab Highway Patrolling Police Paper held on 23-06-2024

questions.q: نماز خسوف کس موقع پر پڑھی جاتی ہے
questions.ex: نماز خسوف چاند گرہن کے موقع پر پڑھی جاتی ہے۔

questions.q: Pakistan and china have signed an agreement for ___railway track inl 2019.
questions.ex: Pakistan and China signed an agreement for the ML-1 railway track upgrade in 2019.

questions.q: Dynamite was discovered by Alfred Nobel in 1887 in _______?
questions.ex: Dynamite was discovered by Alfred Nobel in Sweden in 1867, not 1887.

questions.q: When UNICEF was founded?
questions.ex: UNICEF was founded on 11 December 1946.

questions.q: What is the capital of Denmark?
questions.ex: The capital of Denmark is Copenhagen.

questions.q: What is the Capital of Algeria?
questions.ex: The capital of Algeria is Algiers.

questions.q: where is the office of the UN high commissioner for human rights located
questions.ex: The office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights is located in Geneva.

questions.q: In the constitution of Pakistan, 1973, ‘Chapter 1: Fundamental rights’ consists of Articles?
questions.ex: Chapter 1: Fundamental Rights in the 1973 Constitution of Pakistan consists of Articles 8-28.

questions.q: Sovereignty belongs to ____
questions.ex: In the context of Pakistan's constitution, sovereignty belongs to Allah.

questions.q: How many members are there in Arab League?
questions.ex: As of recent times, the Arab League has 22 members.

questions.q: Pakistan test-fired its first submarine-launched cruise missile Babur-III on 9 January 2017, has the range in kilometres?
questions.ex: The Babur-III missile has a range of 450 kilometers.

questions.q: Which is the largest oil company of the world?
questions.ex: ExxonMobil is one of the world's largest publicly traded international oil and gas companies.

questions.q: Hazrat Abu Bakr (R.A) belonged to the tribe of______?
questions.ex: Hazrat Abu Bakr (R.A) belonged to the tribe of Banu Taym.

questions.q: Bala Hisar Fort is located in ____ ?
questions.ex: Bala Hisar Fort is located in Peshawar.

questions.q: How many Surah are with the name of Prophets?
questions.ex: There are several Surahs named after Prophets including Yunus, Hud, Yusuf, Ibrahim, Muhammad, Nuh, and others. So, the count is more than the options provided.

questions.q: The Largest Muslim country in the world by landmass/area is ____?
questions.ex: Kazakhstan is the largest Muslim-majority country by land area.

questions.q: For how many days Hazrat Younas remained in the abdomen of fish?
questions.ex: According to Islamic tradition, Hazrat Younas (A.S) remained in the abdomen of the fish for 40 days and nights.

questions.q: Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was disqualified by the Supreme Court of Pakistan on ______?
questions.ex: Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was disqualified by the Supreme Court of Pakistan on July 28, 2017.

questions.q: The synonym of DEPLETE is?
questions.ex: The closest synonym for 'deplete' is 'reduce', meaning to diminish or exhaust something.

questions.q: When was the first Pakistani Postal Stamp issued?
questions.ex: The first Pakistani Postal Stamp was issued on 12th July, 1948.

questions.q: Baht is the currency of which country?
questions.ex: Baht is the currency of Thailand.

questions.q: When sixth Census was held in Pakistan?
questions.ex: The sixth Census of Pakistan was held in 2017.

questions.q: The biggest export market of Pakistan.
questions.ex: The USA has traditionally been one of the biggest export markets for Pakistan.

questions.q: Which category of the following can be given Zakat ?
questions.ex: Zakat can be given to all the categories mentioned: the poor and needy, for Islamic educational institutions (Deeni madaris), and to debtors.

questions.q: As of 2023, which cricket team won the most ODI men’s Cricket World Cups?
questions.ex: As of 2023, Australia has won the most ODI men's Cricket World Cups.

questions.q: What is the old name of Hyderabad?
questions.ex: The old name of Hyderabad was Nerunkot or Naroon Kot.

questions.q: Which is the largest lake in Pakistan?
questions.ex: Manchar Lake is the largest natural freshwater lake in Pakistan.

questions.q: Which Angel is appointed providing for Rain, Food?
questions.ex: Hazrat Meekail (A.S) is the Angel appointed for providing sustenance, including rain and food.

questions.q: Which of the following won the mixed doubles tennis title at the 2024 Australian Open?
questions.ex: Hsieh Su-wei and Jan Zieliński won the mixed doubles title at the 2024 Australian Open. Piotr Zielinski is not a well-known tennis player, likely a typo in the options.

questions.q: Report of Montagu – Chelmsford was published in ____?
questions.ex: The Montagu-Chelmsford Report was published on 8th July, 1918.

questions.q: Identify the last ghazwa in which Holy prophet (PBUH) participated
questions.ex: The last Ghazwa in which the Holy Prophet (PBUH) participated was Ghazwa Tabuk.

questions.q: Where is the Headquarter of ASEAN located?
questions.ex: The Headquarter of ASEAN is located in Jakarta, Indonesia.

questions.q: The meaning of word RISALAT is________?
questions.ex: Risalat means messengership or the mission of a Messenger (Prophet).

questions.q: When the first constitution was abrogated and the first martial law was enforced?
questions.ex: The first constitution of Pakistan was abrogated and the first martial law was enforced in October 1958.

questions.q: Test Career highest individual score record 400 runs in one innings is held by?
questions.ex: The highest individual score in Test cricket is 400* by Brian Lara.

questions.q: How many total police stations in Punjab?
questions.ex: This number can change. Please refer to the most recent official data for the exact number of police stations in Punjab.

questions.q: Khanpur dam is situated in ____?
questions.ex: Khanpur Dam is built on the Haro River.

questions.q: Who was the first governor of Province of Balochistan?
questions.ex: Mir Ghaus Bakhsh Bizenjo was the first civilian governor of Balochistan.

questions.q: British Indian Association was formed in _____?
questions.ex: The British Indian Association was formed in 1851.

questions.q: You should adapt _____ your environment.
questions.ex: The correct preposition is 'to'. You adapt to your environment.

questions.q: Choose the correct spelling: Gazatte, Gazette, Gazete, Gazet
questions.ex: The correct spelling is 'Gazette'.

questions.q: Choose the correct spelling: Miscellaneous, Missellaneous, Misscellaneous, Misscellanious
questions.ex: The correct spelling is 'Miscellaneous'.

questions.q: Choose the correct spelling: Pairallel, Peiralel, Parallel, Parrallell
questions.ex: The correct spelling is 'Parallel'.

questions.q: Choose the correct spelling: Advanturous, Addventoros, Adventurose, Adventurous
questions.ex: The correct spelling is 'Adventurous'.

questions.q: He said, “I shall come tomorrow”. (Change into indirect speech).
options: He said that he would come the following day.
He said he would come the following day.
He said that he would come tomorrow.
He said that he will come the following day.
questions.ex: In indirect speech, 'tomorrow' changes to 'the following day' and 'shall' changes to 'would'.

questions.q: He said, “I passed the examination long ago”. (Change into indirect speech).
options: He said I passed the examination.
He said that he had passed the examination long before.
He said he had passed the examination long before.
He asked that he has passed the examination long before.
questions.ex: In indirect speech, the past simple ('passed') changes to the past perfect ('had passed') and 'ago' changes to 'before' or 'earlier'.

questions.q: Synonyms of “Disclose” is?
questions.ex: The synonym of 'disclose' (to make known) is 'reveal'.

questions.q: You can’t take hot coffee. What is hot in grammar?
questions.ex: 'Hot' describes the noun 'coffee', so it is an adjective.

questions.q: The leopard runs. What is runs in grammar?
questions.ex: 'Runs' is an action word, so it is a verb.

questions.q: The officer was ______ the seat.
questions.ex: The most appropriate preposition in this context is 'by'.

questions.q: Hurrah! We have got the prize. Which kind of sentence is this?
questions.ex: The sentence expresses strong emotion and ends with an exclamation mark, making it an exclamatory sentence.

questions.q: She said, “Is this your book?” (Change into indirect speech).
options: She asked if that was her book.
She asked if that was my book.
She asked if this was her book.
She asked if this was his book.
questions.ex: In indirect speech, 'this' can change to 'that', and 'your' changes based on who 'she' is talking to (assumed to be 'me' in this context, thus 'my').

questions.q: Which area is called Pearl of Himalaya
questions.ex: Kaghan Valley is often referred to as the 'Pearl of the Himalayas'.

questions.q: Six men earn as much as 7 women, 2 women as much as 3 boys and 4 boys as much as 5 girls. If a girl earns Rs.400.00 a week what does a man earn in a day.
questions.ex: This requires a step-by-step calculation based on the ratios of earnings. Assuming a 7-day week for daily earning calculation: 5 girls = 4 boys, so 1 boy = 5/4 girls. If a girl earns Rs.400/week, a boy earns (5/4)*400 = Rs.500/week. 2 women = 3 boys, so 1 woman = 3/2 boys. A woman earns (3/2)*500 = Rs.750/week. 6 men = 7 women, so 1 man = 7/6 women. A man earns (7/6)*750 = Rs.875/week. Daily earning for a man (assuming 7 days) = 875/7 = Rs.125/day. The options seem to be based on daily earnings. If a girl earns Rs.400/week, let's assume this is for a certain number of working days. The relationships are given in terms of earning capacity over the same period (implied). Let's calculate daily earnings assuming a 7-day week. Girl's daily earning = 400/7. 4 boys earn as much as 5 girls, so 4 * (Boy's daily earning) = 5 * (400/7). Boy's daily earning = (5/4) * (400/7) = 500/7. 2 women earn as much as 3 boys, so 2 * (Woman's daily earning) = 3 * (500/7). Woman's daily earning = (3/2) * (500/7) = 750/7. 6 men earn as much as 7 women, so 6 * (Man's daily earning) = 7 * (750/7). 6 * (Man's daily earning) = 750. Man's daily earning = 750/6 = Rs. 125.00.

questions.q: Fish : Swims, Horse : ?
questions.ex: Fish swim, and horses run as their primary mode of movement.

questions.q: The Antonym of Large is?
questions.ex: The opposite of large is small.

questions.q: The Synonym of Bad is?
questions.ex: Unhappy is a synonym for bad in terms of feeling or situation.

questions.q: The Synonym of Interest is?
questions.ex: Like is a synonym for interest in terms of having a preference for something.

questions.q: Singular of Foot is?
questions.ex: Foot is already singular. Feet is the plural.

questions.q: The Antonym of Complete is?
questions.ex: The opposite of complete is incomplete.

questions.q: The word Postman is?
questions.ex: Postman refers to a person regardless of gender, making it a common gender noun (though 'postal worker' is a more modern term).

questions.q: The word Girl is?
questions.ex: Girl is a noun that refers to a female, making it feminine gender.

questions.q: The word Cleaner is?
questions.ex: Cleaner refers to a person who cleans, regardless of gender, making it a common gender noun.

questions.q: The word Chairman is?
questions.ex: Chairman is a noun that traditionally refers to a male in charge, making it masculine gender (though 'chairperson' or 'chair' are more modern gender-neutral terms).

questions.q: 18 + 15 is equal to :
1/2 means :
questions.ex: 1/2 represents half of a whole.

questions.q: Choose the even number from the below?
questions.ex: An even number is divisible by 2. Out of the options, only 2 is even.

questions.q: Choose the odd number from the below?
questions.ex: An odd number is not divisible by 2. Out of the options, only 5 is odd.

questions.q: The correct unit for measuring milk is?
questions.ex: Milk is a liquid, and liquids are typically measured in liters.

questions.q: Triangle has ___ sides.
questions.ex: A triangle is a polygon with three sides.
400 multiplied by 6 is 2400.
900 multiplied by 3 is 2700.
1200 multiplied by 4 is 4800.
1300 multiplied by 5 is 6500.
900 divided by 3 is 300.
1200 divided by 4 is 300.
1500 divided by 3 is 500.
2000 divided by 4 is 500.
3000 divided by 5 is 600.

questions.q: Which word does NOT belong with the other? Car, Van, Bike, Potatoes.
questions.ex: Car, Van, and Bike are modes of transport. Potatoes are a type of food.

questions.q: Which word does NOT belong with the other? Orange, Rose, Jasmine, Tulip :
questions.ex: Rose, Jasmine, and Tulip are types of flowers. Orange is a fruit (or a color).

questions.q: Which word does NOT belong with the others? Lion, Elephant, Parrot, Leopard :
questions.ex: Lion, Elephant, and Leopard are mammals. Parrot is a bird.

questions.q: Which word does NOT belong with the others? Accelerate, Tyre, Engine, Leg :
questions.ex: Tyre, Engine, and Leg are parts of a vehicle (or body part). Accelerate is an action.

questions.q: Which word does NOT belong with the others? Chair, Spoon, Couch, Table :
questions.ex: Chair, Couch, and Table are pieces of furniture. Spoon is cutlery.

questions.q: Coffee is taken is a Cup and Rice are taken in :
questions.ex: Coffee is typically consumed from a cup, and rice is typically consumed from a plate.

questions.q: Arrange the words given below in a meaningful sentence: 1. Key 2. Door 3. Lock 4. Room 5. Switch on :
questions.ex: The logical order to enter a room is: use the Key (1) to open the Lock (3) on the Door (2) to enter the Room (4), then Switch on (5) the light.

questions.q: Arrange the words given below in a meaningful sentence: 1. Police 2. Arrest 3. Lockup 4. Thief 5. Stealing :
questions.ex: The logical sequence of events is: A Thief (4) is caught Stealing (5), the Police (1) Arrest (2) them, and they are put in the Lockup (3).

questions.q: Arrange the words given below in a meaningful sentence: 1. Student 2. Teacher 3. Classroom 4. Lesson 5. Homework :
questions.ex: A meaningful sequence is: In the Classroom (3), the Student (1) is taught by the Teacher (2), learns a Lesson (4), and is given Homework (5).

questions.q: Arrange the words given below in a meaningful sentence: 1. Constable 2. DSP 3. Assistant Sub Inspector 4. Sub Inspector 5. Inspector :
questions.ex: This sequence represents a possible hierarchy or progression in a police force: Constable (1), Assistant Sub Inspector (3), Sub Inspector (4), Inspector (5), DSP (2).

questions.q: How many continents are there in the world?
questions.ex: There are seven continents: North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia, and Antarctica.

questions.q: Who was the first man to set foot on the moon?
questions.ex: Neil Armstrong was the first person to walk on the moon.

questions.q: How many months in a year have only 29 days?
questions.ex: Only February has exactly 29 days, and this only happens in a leap year.

questions.q: Complete the series: 2, 4, 6, 8, :
questions.ex: This is a series of even numbers increasing by 2 each time. The next number is 8 + 2 = 10.
600 multiplied by 3 is 1800.

questions.q: Complete the series: 12, 14, 16 18, :
questions.ex: This is a series of even numbers increasing by 2 each time. The next number is 18 + 2 = 20.

questions.q: Complete the series: 11, 13, 15, 17, :
questions.ex: This is a series of odd numbers increasing by 2 each time. The next number is 17 + 2 = 19.

questions.q: Complete the series: 3, 5, 7, 9, :
questions.ex: This is a series of odd numbers increasing by 2 each time. The next number is 9 + 2 = 11.

questions.q: Complete the series: ABC, DEF, GHI, :
questions.ex: This is a series of consecutive letters of the alphabet in groups of three. After GHI comes JKL.

questions.q: Complete the series: XYZ, UVW, RST, :
questions.ex: This is a series of consecutive letters of the alphabet in reverse order in groups of three. Before RST comes OPQ.

questions.q: Complete the series: 10, 12, 14, 16, :
questions.ex: This is a series of even numbers increasing by 2 each time. The next number is 16 + 2 = 18.
